required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Re-examination Study for General Drug Use to Assess the Safety and Efficacy Profile of EZETROL® in Usual Practice

brief_summary.textblock: This survey is conducted for preparing application materials for re-examination under the Pharmaceutical Affairs Laws and its Enforcement Regulation, its aim is to reconfirm the clinical usefulness of EZETROL® through collecting the safety information according to the Re-examination Regulation for New Drugs.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With Any Clinical and/or Laboratory Adverse Experience While Being Treated With EZETROL® Within 14 Days After Treatment Discontinuation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 14 days after treatment discontinuation
primary_outcome.description: Participants who recieved EZETROL® and experienced any adverse event related or unrelated to EZETROL®, within 14 days after treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change From Baseline to Treatment in Lipid Parameters
primary_outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline to treatment in lipid parameters (total cholesterol [TC], low-density lipoprotein [LDL] cholesterol, high-density lipoprotein [HDL] cholesterol, triglycerides[TG]) in participants who received EZETROL over 4 weeks and then had available laboratory results in Lipid Parameters.
Participants who received EZETROL over 4 weeks and then have been evaluated for overall efficacy assessment by investigator showing to be improved, unchanged or worsened.

arm_group.description: Participants with Hypercholesterolemia treated with EZETROL®

study_pop.textblock: Participants with Hypercholesterolemia treated with EZETROL®

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants Who Receives EZETROL® In Usual Medical Practice

group.title: EZETROL® 10 mg
group.description: Participants with Hypercholesterolemia and Homozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia(HoFH) treated with EZETROL® 10 mg once daily.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Treatment prior to date of contract
Violation of inclusions & off label use

group.title: EZETROL® 10 mg
group.description: Participants with Hypercholesterolemia and Homozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia(HoFH) treated with EZETROL® 10 mg once daily.

outcome.title: Participants With Any Clinical and/or Laboratory Adverse Experience While Being Treated With EZETROL® Within 14 Days After Treatment Discontinuation
outcome.description: Participants who recieved EZETROL® and experienced any adverse event related or unrelated to EZETROL®, within 14 days after treatment.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 14 days after treatment discontinuation

group.title: EZETROL® 10 mg
group.description: Participants with Hypercholesterolemia and Homozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia(HoFH) treated with EZETROL® 10 mg once daily.

measure.title: Participants With Any Clinical and/or Laboratory Adverse Experience While Being Treated With EZETROL® Within 14 Days After Treatment Discontinuation
measure.description: Participants who recieved EZETROL® and experienced any adverse event related or unrelated to EZETROL®, within 14 days after treatment.

outcome.title: Mean Percent Change From Baseline to Treatment in Lipid Parameters
outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline to treatment in lipid parameters (total cholesterol [TC], low-density lipoprotein [LDL] cholesterol, high-density lipoprotein [HDL] cholesterol, triglycerides[TG]) in participants who received EZETROL over 4 weeks and then had available laboratory results in Lipid Parameters.
outcome.population: 3,309 subjects were analyzed for the efficacy evaluation; 227 of the enrolled subjects did not complete the study and were excluded

measure.title: Mean Percent Change From Baseline to Treatment in Lipid Parameters
measure.description: The mean percent change from baseline to treatment in lipid parameters (total cholesterol [TC], low-density lipoprotein [LDL] cholesterol, high-density lipoprotein [HDL] cholesterol, triglycerides[TG]) in participants who received EZETROL over 4 weeks and then had available laboratory results in Lipid Parameters.
measure.population: 3,309 subjects were analyzed for the efficacy evaluation; 227 of the enrolled subjects did not complete the study and were excluded

outcome.title: Overall Efficacy Evaluation of EZETROL®
outcome.description: Participants who received EZETROL over 4 weeks and then have been evaluated for overall efficacy assessment by investigator showing to be improved, unchanged or worsened.
outcome.population: 3,309 subjects were analyzed for the efficacy evaluation; 227 of the enrolled subjects did not complete the study and were excluded

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
